quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Game and Ball
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, process, coffee. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: According to urban legends, the Titantic sank because it was carrying which of the following?

options.text: A man trying to outrun a gypsys curse

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A cursed mummy

questions.question: According to urban legends, in Plainfield, Wisconsin the ghosts of two murdered girls return to kill and skin their parents. Why?

options.text: The parents didnt tell their subsequent son about his sisters.
The parents didnt report the girls murders.
The parents sold the girls to be murdered.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The parents didnt tell their subsequent son about his sisters.

questions.question: This man invented the alarm clock so he could awake at 4 A.M. every morning.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Levi Hutchins

questions.question: He was the first African-American pitcher in Major League Baseball.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dan Bankhead

questions.question: Woody and Buzz Light Year are characters from this video game based on a Disney movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Toy Story

questions.question: This person was the first African-American to hit a home run in Major League Baseball.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dan Bankhead

questions.question: In order to play this game, you need a net, a ball and 6 team players. Most common faults include: causing the ball to touch the ground outside the opponents court and double hit (two consecutive contacts with the ball made by the same player)
This popular board game is published by Parker Brothers. The board consists of forty spaces containing twenty-eight properties.
Who invented a process to remove caffeine from coffee for the first time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roselius and Wimmer

questions.question: This show is credited by the Guinness Book of World Records as being the longest-running soap opera. Its 15,000th episode aired on September 7, 2006.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Guiding Light

questions.question: Of the following properties, which is the most expensive in the board game Monopoly (American edition)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pacific Avenue

questions.question: In this game show, created by Merv Griffin in 1964, you always have to say What is...? before you say the answer.
In this American strategic life-simulation computer game you rule peoples lives. The game was developed by Maxis and published by Electronic Arts.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sims

questions.question: According to urban legends, at Santa Fes Loretto Chapel, this structure defies the laws of physics, standing without any support.

options.text: A stained glass window depicting Jesus
A stained glass window depicting St. Joseph

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A spiral staircase

questions.question: He invented instant coffee in 1901.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Satori Koto

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Fear and Jeans
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, straps, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: According to urban legends that spread in 1997, people in this country began pumping air from a bicycle pump into their rectum resulting in their explosion.
Which term means fear of being touched?
Women who wear their purse straps across their chests are at risk of being beheaded by purse snatchers.
According to an urban legend, an electrical worker is blinded for life when the following item/s fuse(s) to his eyes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His contact lenses

questions.question: Albuminurophobia is defined as fear of albums.
What does amathophobia mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fear of dust

questions.question: What term means fear of darkness?
Thieves, rapists, gang members and psychopaths lie in wait under their victims cars and slash their victims Achilles tendon so they cant escape. When did this urban legend begin circulating?
According to an urban legend, in Geneva in 2002 an intoxicated groom was suffocated at his bachelor party by which of the following?

options.text: Passing out face down on the shag carpet

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A strippers large breasts

questions.question: The fear of stars and celestial space is known as astrophobia.
According to popular urban legends, the ghost of an Indiana teen who was killed after 5 other teens pushed her into the sewer will kill anyone who doesnt do which of the following?

options.text: Draw a cross on 5 manhole covers
Light a candle in her memory

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Repost her story on Myspace

questions.question: According to a story, a teenage girl wears her new pair of shrink-to-fit jeans in the bathtub in order to acheive the perfect fit. Unfortunately, the jeans shrink so much that they kill her with their constricting force. What brand of jeans is responsible?
What does acrophobia mean?
This word means fear of cats. Meow!
Ataxophobia means fear of paying taxes.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Countries and Fear
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, saving, following. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: According to their mission statement, what is the primary goal of the US Central Intelligence Agency?

options.text: Providing national security intelligence to senior US policymakers
Rescuing US citizens from terrorists around the world
Spying on all aliens on US territory

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Providing national security intelligence to senior US policymakers

questions.question: In the American Civil War, what were the southern US states referred to as?
Which of the following is the correct name of an African nation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Republic of South Africa

questions.question: Not accounting for daylight saving, what is the hour difference between Central Time Zone (CST) in America and Central European Time (CET)?
Which of these countries is NOT fictional?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Central African Republic

questions.question: Autophobia means fear of cars.
What is the prevalent language in Central America?
Which of these countries is in Central Europe?
In which New York City borough is Central Park located?
What is the Central Processing Unit (aka CPU) responsible for?

options.text: Advising US governments on internal matters

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Executing computer programs

questions.question: What is Cordillera Central?

options.text: City Center in Far East Asian countries
The central mountain range in several Spanish speaking countries
A special undercover police unit in Australia
The geographical center of any country or region

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The central mountain range in several Spanish speaking countries

questions.question: What is Comedy Central?

options.text: A spin-off of the famous Monty Python group
A film studio owned by Jim Carrey
An American TV station that broadcasts mostly comedy programs
The company that owns rights to all comedy movies on YouTube

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An American TV station that broadcasts mostly comedy programs

questions.question: What is the position number of a Center in basketball?
Ataxiophobia means fear of riding a taxi.
Which of these US states comes in North and South flavours?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Country and Color
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, field, birds. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the other common name of the shade of green known as midnight green?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eagle green

questions.question: Which of these is an existing country, recognized by the United Nations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Korea

questions.question: The flag of what country consists of a simple green field with no other features?
Why do most fish, reptiles, amphibians, and birds appear green?

options.text: They are able to change their color in order to camouflage themselves
Because most of them feed on green plants
Their skin contains a specific green pigment
Because of a reflection of blue light coming through an over-layer of yellow pigment

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of a reflection of blue light coming through an over-layer of yellow pigment

questions.question: What is the first name of Dr. Greene from the popular television series ER, played by actor Anthony Edwards?
What character from the famous American sitcom Friends has the last name of Green?
Name the country below which is NOT located in South America.
Who was the first person to reach both the North and South Poles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roald Amundsen

questions.question: The green color is considered to be the traditional and most sacred color of this religion.
What was the green color associated with during the Middle Ages according to some stories from that period?
What island is often referred to as the Emerald Isle, the green color being its symbol?
What does the expression to wear a green hat mean in popular Chinese culture?

options.text: to be an immature, foolish person

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: to be a cuckold

questions.question: Three of these are not real bodies of water; which one is?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Sea

questions.question: Which of the following is a major US airline and a subsidiary of Delta Air Lines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Northwest Airlines

questions.question: Due to the presence of trace amounts of this chemical emeralds appear green.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Earth and India
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, title, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A specimen from which of these species was listed in the Guinness Book of World Records as the longest bony fish alive?
Who was the first Chinese writer to win the Nobel Prize for Literature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gao Xingjian

questions.question: What does the Hebrew word gaon mean?
Which is greater: the circumference of Earth from pole to pole or the circumference of Earth around the equator?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The equatorial circumference

questions.question: Which of these languages does not belong to the Germanic language family?
Which country has Bratislava as its capital city, and the koruna as its unit of currency?
The Mississippi is the longest North American river. The Missouri is the second. What is the third longest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rio Grande

questions.question: This former Prime Minister of India was born in India to a Brahmin family. For a while this leader was a professor of Political Science at the Takshashila University and was one of the first to envision the concept of a unified India.
How many men held the title King of England in 1936?

options.text: 3 -  George V, Edward VIII, and George VI

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3 -  George V, Edward VIII, and George VI

questions.question: One angstrom unit equal what length in meters?
In physics, what does Avogadros law state?

options.text: At the same mass and pressure, equal volumes of gases contain the same number of molecules.
Volumes of gases containing the same number of molecules have equal pressures.
Volumes of gases containing the same number of molecules have equal pressures and masses.
At the same temperature and pressure, equal volumes of gases contain the same number of molecules.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: At the same temperature and pressure, equal volumes of gases contain the same number of molecules.

questions.question: Iron makes up 35.1 % of Earth. 28.2 % is oxygen. What is the third leading element of Earths composition?

This composer, who lived 1865-1957, was born to a Swedish speaking family in a Russian-owned part of Finland. His compositions include: Valse Triste,  The Swan of Tuonela, and seven fine symphonies. What is the last name of this composer?
The color named gamboge is a shade of this color.
From which language do we get the word tattoo?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Color and Shade
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, field, june. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The call of the Blue Jay is often compared to the sound produced by this object.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rusty pump

questions.question: The color xanadu is a shade of this color.
What type of color is the shade called icterine?
What day of the week is associated with the blue color in Thailand?
The name of the color sangria comes from the Spanish word sangre. What does it mean?
Ube is a shade of this color.
What is the color of the Dont Walk pedestrian crossing signal in Canada and the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Portland Orange

questions.question: A shade of which color is the so-called June bud color?
What country employs the blue color as its national sports color, as it denotes secularism?
According to Hindu tradition, the fifth chakra, called Vishuddha and associated with the blue color, is located in this part of the body.
What type of color is the shade called saffron?
The national flag of what country consists of a light blue field with a single white star in the center?
What animal was the color taupe named after?
The color called sepia is a shade of this color.
In historical atlases published in Germany, Germany is traditionally painted in light blue. What color is traditionally used for England?
